;美国国会共和党领袖周二表示，他可能会发起弹劾调查如果政府未能提供调查总统及其家人的委员会寻求的信息，就会向民主党总统乔·拜登进行调查。

;

;共和党控制的众议院的三个委员会正在调查拜登未经证实的财务不当行为指控，他的儿子亨特·拜登和其他家庭成员，白宫将其斥为“疯狂的阴谋论”。

;

;“现在发生的事情是司法委员会正在继续调查，”众议院议长凯文·麦卡锡告诉记者。 “如果政府部门……拒绝让我们获得我们所要求的信息，就会引发弹劾调查。”

;

;白宫发言人卡琳·让-皮埃尔 (Karine Jean-Pierre) 周二否认了这种可能性弹劾调查。

;

;“他关注的是美国家庭，但他们也想关注他的家庭。他们可以做任何他们想做的事，但我们将保持专注，”让-皮埃尔说。

;

;麦卡锡的共和党核心小组成员在赢得选举后不久就开始提出弹劾拜登的想法。在 11 月的选举中以微弱优势获胜，一些人呼吁投票“消除”对共和党前总统唐纳德·特朗普的两项弹劾。

;

;麦卡锡在亨特·拜登预计将认罪的前一天对记者发表了讲话轻罪指控故意不缴纳所得税并签订一项可以避免对枪支相关指控定罪的协议。

;

;在其他指控中，共和党人声称司法部进行了干预以限制亨特·拜登调查，尽管特朗普在该案中任命的检察官表示他没有受到限制。

;

;随着亨特·拜登达成认罪协议，看看他麻烦不断的过去

;

;涉及众议院的调查自 6 月份特朗普联邦大陪审团起诉以来，监督、司法和筹款委员会加强了监督。

;

;众议院共和党人指责拜登将司法部“武器化”，以应对不当行为的指控，为特朗普辩护。 2024 年共和党白宫候选人。

;

;上周，众议院监督委员会听取了两名国税局举报人的证词，他们表示司法部在亨特·拜登的调查上拖延，首席调查员、美国检察官大卫·韦斯 (David Weiss) 被剥夺了特别检察官的授权。

;

;韦斯预计将于今年晚些时候在国会作证，他在给共和党参议员林赛·格雷厄姆 (Lindsey Graham) 的一封信中否认了司法部的干预，并表示他从未寻求特别检察官地位。

;

;共和党对拜登及其家人的一些指控涉及乌克兰能源公司 Burisma，该公司在特朗普 2019 年首次弹劾中发挥了关键作用，因为特朗普涉嫌向乌克兰施压，要求其调查拜登家族并帮助他获胜连任。

;

;共和党占多数的参议院后来宣判特朗普无罪。

;

;麦卡锡引用了联邦调查局的一份报告，其中包含一位身份不明的线人的说法，该线人称布里斯马官员试图向拜登家族支付 500 万美元2015 年和 2016 年，他们帮助驱逐了一名调查该能源公司的乌克兰检察官。

;

;共和党人试图以史无前例的举动消除特朗普的弹劾

;

;对拜登不当行为的指控乌克兰的前特朗普内部人士列夫·帕纳斯(Lev Parnas)反驳了这一说法，他帮助前纽约市长和前特朗普律师鲁迪·朱利安尼(Rudy Giuliani)试图挖掘有关乌克兰拜登家族的破坏性信息。

;

;“没有证据”帕纳斯在 7 月 18 日致众议院监督委员会的信中表示，“乔或亨特·拜登干涉乌克兰政治，以前从未有过”。

;

;帕纳斯是一名乌克兰裔美国商人，正在为 20 名乌克兰裔美国商人提供服务。因在一家虚假公司中诈骗投资者并代表俄罗斯寡头向美国政治候选人非法捐款而被软禁一个月。

;

; Wed, 26 Jul 2023 08:20:02 +0800 Hong Kong tourism desperately needs a boost in the changed post-Covid landscapehttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3228763/hong-kong-tourism-desperately-needs-boost-changed-post-covid-landscape?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.26 08:15;
;;

;尽管香港游客人数的复苏速度慢于预期，但仍有更多香港人过境

;

;根据旅游局初步数据，上个月，到香港旅游的游客有275万人次，其中大陆游客占215万人次。半年总量近1300万，其中超过1000万来自内地。尽管入境人数有所改善，但大陆游客仍低于许多人的预期。

;

;与此同时，有大量媒体报道称，前往深圳一日游美食和娱乐的香港人激增。香港旅游业缓慢的复苏正被这些北行口岸蒙上阴影。

;

;这种不平衡现象反映在支付宝收集的第二季度数据中：香港人在内地的消费金额和支付交易次数比前三个月增加了三倍多。其他旅行和消费数据也显示出类似的趋势。香港人正涌入深圳及周边城市。

;

;为什么香港解除Covid-19限制后，没有迎来内地“报复性”旅游的激增？我们要问的是，如果香港连吸引更多本国人来消磨时光的吸引力都不够，又怎么能吸引内地游客呢？

;

;以前深圳人都是这样的。想去香港疯狂购物。在旅游业最繁荣的时候，深圳人甚至下班后还乘地铁去香港买酱油。他们这样做是因为既可以省钱，又可以买到更优质的商品。

;

;但香港的购物折扣不再那么诱人，而且这个城市几乎没有新的旅游景点。内地购物平台的快速发展也为中国消费者提供了更多的选择和优惠。当这么多国际品牌和商品一键就能买到时，在香港购物的吸引力就下降了。

;

;Covid-19疫情期间，内地旅游业经历了巨大挑战，促使旅游从业者更加努力，深度调整，重塑业务。

;

;产品供给、用户偏好、预订行为、市场环境都发生了巨大变化。然而，香港旅游业的大多数人似乎并没有充分跟上全球旅游市场和千禧一代度假者的变化。

;

;全球大多数度假者变得更加环保和富有冒险精神；越来越多的旅行者正在寻找适合他们身心的活动和事物，例如艺术、文化和体育。因此，提升香港作为艺术和文化中心的形象并增加提供的康乐活动可以重新吸引年轻一代的游客，不仅来自内地，而且来自世界各地。

;

;香港可以做什么是否需要改进以吸引更多内地游客？或许，我们可以从一个很小的例子中看到一种可能的出路。

;

;目前，香港故宫文化博物馆可供游客购买的本地专属文创产品并不多，大部分都是来自北京故宫博物院，可在线查阅。这削弱了内地游客在香港故宫文化博物馆的消费。

;

;虽然这看起来微不足道，但它反映出香港文创旅游业需要更加努力，以确保无论是来自内地还是其他地方的游客，将香港视为一个令人兴奋且有益的旅游目的地。要注重文化与旅游的融合，吸引游客来香港、了解香港。

;

;要吸引游客回流，香港必须注重原汁原味、独特

;

; h3>;

;当然，我们也应该清醒地认识到，鉴于一些国家对中国内地和香港表现出的敌意和不信任，吸引西方游客的难度很大。为了应对这种情况，香港必须继续在这些市场做好公关工作。

;

;我们应该开拓其他客源，例如中东、东南亚和南美，同时努力推出更多高端客源。介绍文化和娱乐活动。毕竟，艺术、娱乐和体育赛事可以成为超越地缘政治敌意的有效方式。

;

;中国在军事人工智能方面的进步，虽然大部分是渐进式的且范围有限，但可能会带来成果美国一家智库的报告警告称，这些可能会发生革命性变化，并可能增加与美国发生武装冲突的风险。

;

;这些可能性要求美国做好应对此类风险的准备，因为美国与中国的竞争正在加剧。总部位于华盛顿的新美国安全中心专注于美国国家安全和国防政策，该中心表示，这一趋势将进一步加强。

;

;“在近期和中期，人工智能将带来的大部分变化将是渐进的和狭窄的。但从中长期来看，有些可能是革命性的和普遍的，”报告称。

;

;“中国在其军事现代化努力上几乎没有提供透明度，包括人工智能，这有一天可能会导致战略如果北京设法秘密取得突破，美国将大吃一惊。”报告补充道。

;

;在涉及各自战略的双边紧张局势中，中美两国都在迅速采取行动，将人工智能技术融入其军队。报告称，人工智能在中国的军事野心中发挥着“关键作用”，尤其是到本世纪中叶成为“世界一流军队”的目标。部分通过“智能化”进行，该术语指的是将人工智能和其他新兴技术整合到其武装部队中。

;

;“如果将各个领域的军事人工智能的进步加在一起，美中报告称：“如果军事平衡向对北京有利的方向发展，那么发生冲突的风险可能会上升。”

;

;通过开发和部署军事人工智能等技术，北京最终可能超越美国及其盟友，这些技术将为其带来巨大的影响力。它补充说，这是优势。

;

;军事专家表示，解放军在台湾附近部署了远程导弹

;

;但是，该报告列举了中国在寻求军事人工智能霸权过程中可能面临的几个障碍，包括美国及其盟国实施的技术控制。这些“可能会阻碍北京大规模开发和运行人工智能系统的能力”。

;

;“在军事现代化的早期阶段，中国可以模仿美国、俄罗斯和其他先进军队，”报告指出。 “相比之下，智能化需要开创全新的军事技术和如何使用它们的作战概念。”

;

;去年 10 月，拜登政府宣布对向中国出售半导体技术实行全面新限制，旨在限制国家的军事发展。

;

;周二的报告概述了作者称之为“途径”的五类，通过这些途径，军事人工智能的应用可能会破坏稳定并增加武装冲突或核战争威胁的风险。华盛顿和北京。

;

;中国称“某个国家”正在阻碍其他国家的技术发展

;

;例如，它表示人工智能决策应用程序可能会产生不良信息，导致政策制定者报告称，错误的决定以及人工智能在无人自主系统中的应用可能会增加故意、无意或意外升级的可能性，特别是在危机时期。

;

;“在台湾未来潜在的突发事件中中美之间有可能发生高端战斗，但不能保证针对机器人系统的行动（尤其是武装机器人系统）会受到如此克制。”

;

;作为回应，美国报告称，政策制定者应采取大胆行动，阻止中国在军事人工智能方面取得进展，并与中国就军事人工智能相关的降低风险和建立信任措施进行谈判。

;

;“评估和管理由此产生的战略风险将需要密切关注北京的民用，尤其是军事人工智能活动……降低战略风险最终需要与中国竞争和选择性接触相结合。”

;海洋专家呼吁香港人不要到西贡海域观鲸本月早些时候看到的一只巨型哺乳动物被发现背部有螺旋桨伤口。

;

;海洋公园保育基金会获得的一张由一名公众周六拍摄的照片显示，它的背部至少有两处深深的伤口鲸鱼的背部。

;

;围观者惊讶地发现鲸鱼在香港东部水域进食

;

;首次发现这种哺乳动物，据信是布氏鲸，身长约七米（23 英尺）七月中旬，靠近百万富翁海滩或南风湾的石港沿岸，以及西贡附近海域。这一目击事件在当地引起了极大的兴趣，人们乘船出海寻找它。

;

;它消失了好几天，直到周末在科学技术大学附近的牛尾港看到它，还有一些成员公开报道称它张开大口进食。

;

;香港海豚保护协会主席、海洋生物学家张开泰周二表示，根据这张照片，他几乎百分百确定伤口是由船舶螺旋桨造成的，从它们的平行图案可以看出。

;

;他敦促公众不要租船去观鲸，以免对动物造成进一步的伤害。张还表示，这头鲸鱼可能迷路了。

;

;“由于受伤，它在寻找出路（返回栖息地）时将面临更大的困难，”张说，并补充说，它还面临着更多的困难。进食方面的挑战。

;

;香港两天内第二次发现鲸鱼，专家称给动物带来和平

;

;协会早前表示鲸鱼可能在航行中迷路并进入香港水域，这不是它通常的栖息地。

;

;海洋公园和海洋公园保护基金会表示，周末有人发现一群人接近鲸鱼，这可能会给它带来压力并导致危及生命的后果，例如无法休息或进食以及遭受创伤。

;

;他们再次呼吁人们不要接近船上的鲸鱼。

;

;基金会的科学官员 Compass Chan 说：“鲸鱼鲸鱼是敏感生物，很容易受到噪音、突然移动和人为干扰的影响。”

;

;公园及基金会表示会继续与渔农自然护理署合作，评估鲸鱼的状况并确定帮助它的最佳方法。

; Wed, 26 Jul 2023 07:20:02 +0800 US House passes bill to hold Chinese officials accountable for spread of fentanylhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/article/3228922/us-house-passes-bill-hold-chinese-officials-accountable-spread-fentanyl?utm_source=rss_feed

;美国众议院周二通过一项法案，要求中国官员对疫情蔓延负责芬太尼和其他合成阿片类药物在美国的使用。

;

;名为“阻止中国芬太尼”的阿片类药物法案在 2019 年通过的芬太尼制裁法中重新定义了“外国阿片类药物贩运者”，将未能通过芬太尼制裁的中国实体和政府官员包括在内采取措施防止阿片类药物贩运。

;

;“中国共产党在芬太尼危机的每一步中都发挥着突出作用，从生产前体化学品到转让专业知识，再到洗钱卡特尔利润，将其非法贩运到美国该法案的发起人、肯塔基州共和党众议员、众议院中国问题特别委员会成员安迪·巴尔 (Andy Barr) 表示。

;

;周二的两党投票正值美国和中国权衡芬太尼问题协议之际。据《华尔街日报》报道，白宫正在考虑取消对中国警察法证机构的制裁，以确保北京方面在禁毒方面的合作。

;

;双方在国务卿安东尼之前恢复了禁毒谈判。布林肯六月访华，布林肯将合成阿片类药物列为“优先事项”。访问期间，双方讨论了成立一个工作组来解决该问题。

;

;中国大使馆否认美国的说法，称墨西哥芬太尼化学品并非来自中国

;

;但此后，北京进行了反击美国努力起诉和制裁涉嫌参与贩运芬太尼前体的中国个人和制造商。它也没有接受华盛顿的邀请，加入美国领导的全球联盟，以应对本月开始的合成毒品威胁。

;

;直到 2019 年，中国一直被认为是进入美国的芬太尼的主要来源。北京应华盛顿的要求实施了更严格的出口管制。

;

;然而，据美国官员称，中国仍然是关键原料的主要来源，最终阶段的生产能力已大部分转移到墨西哥等国家，成品从这些国家生产可以走私到美国。

;

;众议院周二还通过了一项法案，指示美国国务院报告中国在国际组织中破坏台湾的努力。

;

;要成为法律，这些法案还必须通过参议院，然后由美国总统乔·拜登签署。

;

;参议院目前正在审议《国防授权法案》，这是五角大楼每年必须通过的法案，目前包括 120 多项提到台湾和中国。

;

;众议院本月以微弱优势通过了 NDAA 版本。

; Wed, 26 Jul 2023 06:20:02 +0800 China’s navy includes civilian ferry in military transport drillhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/military/article/3228861/chinas-navy-includes-civilian-ferry-military-transport-drill?utm_source=rss_feed

;中国海军部署民用渡轮运送部队和卡车进行两栖作战测试技能被视为攻击台湾的关键。

;Republican US presidential contender Ron DeSantis is cutting far more campaign staff than previously thought as he works to reset his stumbling campaign amid unexpected financial trouble.

;

;DeSantis, long considered former president Donald Trump's chief rival in the Republican 2024 primary contest, has cut a third of his campaign staff – or 38 people, according to campaign aides who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss internal campaign strategy.

;

;The dramatic staffing cuts include the “less than 10” employees that the DeSantis team revealed letting go earlier in the month just as federal filings showed that his campaign was burning through cash at an unsustainable rate, even before launching a substantial paid advertising campaign.

;

;“Following a top-to-bottom review of our organisation, we have taken additional, aggressive steps to streamline operations and put Ron DeSantis in the strongest position to win this primary and defeat Joe Biden,” DeSantis campaign manager Generra Peck said in a statement.

;

;“DeSantis is going to lead the Great American Comeback and we're ready to hit the ground running as we head into an important month of the campaign.”

;

;Revelations about the staffing cuts came on the same day DeSantis was involved in a multi-car accident on a Tennessee highway in the midst of a fundraising tour.据佛罗里达州州长的竞选活动和执法部门称，他没有受伤。 A female staff member was treated for a minor injury.

;

;The latest revelations mark a new low for a presidential candidate who entered the Republican primary this spring with sky-high expectations as Republican primary voters signalled a willingness to move on from Trump.

;

;Yet two months later, the 44-year-old DeSantis stands a distant second in most polls as Republican operatives and donors alike question his readiness for the national stage.

;

;Anti-Trump video shared by DeSantis campaign is homophobic, says LGBTQ group

;

;Trump's allies immediately celebrated the news of DeSantis' latest campaign struggles on social media.

;

;“TURMOIL IN TALLAHASSEE,” the Trump campaign tweeted.

;

;Still, with the first votes of the primary season still six months away, DeSantis has time to recover as Trump's allies brace for the possibility of a third criminal indictment.

;

;DeSantis' team has quietly expressed confidence for months that voters would eventually tire of Trump's escalating legal troubles and personal baggage. But that same baggage, playing out in the US legal system just as the Republican primary intensifies, is leaving precious little oxygen for him and his rivals to break through.

;

;And Trump's standing with Republican primary voters seems to be growing stronger with every new legal challenge.

;

;Still, DeSantis' team has raised a stunning US$150 million for his presidential ambitions so far. The vast majority, US$130 million, has gone to a super PAC run by allies who cannot legally coordinate with the campaign.

;

;The DeSantis campaign itself raised more than US$20 million in the first six weeks he was in the race, though federal filings released over the weekend revealed that he and his team had burned through more than US$8 million in a spending spree that included more than 100 paid staff, a large security detail and luxury travel.

;The latest staffing cuts were first reported by Politico.

;A Russian fighter plane flew within a few metres of a US drone over Syria and fired flares at it, striking the American aircraft and damaging it, the US military said on Tuesday, the latest in a string of aggressive intercepts by Russia in the region.

;

;A senior Air Force commander said the move on Sunday was an attempt by the Russians to knock the MQ-9 Reaper drone out of the sky and came just a week after a Russian fighter aircraft flew dangerously close to a US surveillance aircraft carrying a crew in the region, jeopardising the lives of the four Americans on board.

;

;“One of the Russian flares struck the US MQ-9, severely damaging its propeller,” Lieutenant General Alex Grynkewich, the head of US Air Forces Central, said in a statement describing the latest close call.

;

;“We call upon the Russian forces in Syria to put an immediate end to this reckless, unprovoked, and unprofessional behaviour.”

;

;Grynkewich said one of the crew members operating the drone remotely kept it in the air and flew it back to its home base.

;

;The Sunday incident is the latest in a series of encounters between Russian fighter planes and US aircraft flying over Syria.

;

;US leaders have noted the uptick and so far have discounted any connection to Russia's ongoing war in Ukraine, where the US and Western allies are actively supporting Kyiv's fight against Moscow.

;

;US Army General Mark Milley, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, said he is uncertain what triggered the increase. “我们有分析师试图解决这个问题。不知道和乌克兰有没有关系。 Right now, there's nothing to suggest that it is,” he told reporters during a recent briefing.

;

;Others have suggested that it stems from a growing coordination among Russia, Syria and Iran and is meant to persuade the US to leave Syria, thus opening the door for more Iranian activity, particularly in the South.

;

;Russian jet flew very close to US plane over Syria, endangering crew, US says

;

;Randa Slim, director of the Conflict Resolution and Track II Dialogues Programme at the Washington-based Middle East Institute, said that before the war in Ukraine, Syria was “seen by the Russians as an arena for competition as well as cooperation with US”.

;

;Their shared interest in Syria included limiting Iran and Turkey's footprints, preventing a military escalation between Iran and Israel that could provoke a regional war, promoting a political solution to the war in Syria, and denying the Islamic State a safe haven.

;

;However, since the war in Ukraine, Slim said “there is an increasing convergence between the Russian and Iranian positions around an endgame that sees US forces pushed out of Syria”.

;

;The US and other allies of Ukraine have accused Iran of supplying hundreds of drones to Russia for its war effort, which Russia denies.

;

;The Deir Ez-Zor province in eastern Syrian has been a particular area of tension among the US, Russia and Iran. Control of the oil-rich province is split between Syrian government forces and the US-backed, Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces, with a presence of both Iranian militias and US troops.

;

;It was also the site of a confrontation between US forces and Russian mercenaries from the Wagner private military company in 2018.

;

;On Monday, Syrian state news agency SANA reported that residents protested in the town of al-Mayadeen, in Deir Ez-Zor province, “in rejection of the American occupation of Syrian lands”, calling for the withdrawal of American and allied SDF forces.

;

;In all of the Russian air intercepts except the one instance a week ago, the US aircraft were MQ-9 drones without crew members. On that Sunday, however, the Russian Su-35 jet few close to a US MC-12 surveillance aircraft with a crew, forcing it to go through the turbulent wake.

;

;US officials at the time called it a significant escalation in the ongoing string of encounters between US and Russian aircraft that could have resulted in an accident or loss of life. They said the Russian move hampered the crew members' ability to safely operate their plane.

;

;22 US troops injured in Syria 'helicopter mishap'

;

;In recent weeks, US officials said, Russian fighter jets have repeatedly harassed US MQ-9 drones, which are conducting anti-Islamic State group missions, largely in western Syria.

;

;On multiple occasions in the past three weeks, the officials said, Russian fighter jets flew dangerously close to the US Reapers, setting off flares and forcing the drones to take evasive manoeuvres.

;

;US and Russian military officers communicate frequently over a deconfliction phone line during the encounters, protesting the other side's actions.

;

;There are about 900 US forces in Syria, and others move in and out to conduct missions targeting Islamic State group militants.

;Russian President Vladimir Putin plans to visit China in October, a top Kremlin official announced on Tuesday.

;

;Russian news agencies quoted Putin's foreign policy adviser, Yuri Ushakov, as saying the trip will be timed to coincide with a Belt and Road Initiative forum in China. Beijing's belt and road plan involves infrastructure projects to connect Asia with European and African countries.

;

;Ushakov said Putin also plans to travel to Turkey at some point to fulfil a promise to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, although the dates for that visit have not been decided yet.

;

;In addition, the Kremlin received an invitation for Putin to participate in a Group of 20 summit in India in September, he said. The Russian leader's in-person attendance has not been ruled out, although the format of Putin's participation is still “unclear”, Ushakov said.

;

;The announcement of Putin's travel plans came days after South African officials said he had agreed to skip an economic summit in their country next month because of an arrest warrant the International Criminal Court issued against him. The ICC has accused Putin of personal responsibility for the abductions of children from Ukraine.

;

;As a signatory to the treaty that established the international court, South Africa would either be obliged to arrest the Russian leader if he set foot there or put in a position of flouting its responsibility.

;

;Staying away from the summit could be viewed as embarrassing for Putin, who is now expected to be the only leader of a country in the Brics bloc of developing economies not to attend. Moscow has dismissed the warrant and said it does not recognise the ICC's jurisdiction.

;

;China, Turkey and India are not signatories to the Rome Statute, so Putin can travel to those countries more easily.

;

;China urges resumption of grain, fertiliser exports from Ukraine, Russia

;

;An October visit would take Putin to China seven months after Chinese President Xi Jinping came to Moscow on a three-day visit. The two also met in person in September 2022 on the sidelines of a regional summit in Uzbekistan.

;

;Before that, Putin met Xi while attending the opening of the 2022 Beijing Winter Games, weeks before he sent troops into Ukraine.

;

;China has sought to project itself as neutral in the Ukraine conflict, even while it has refused to condemn Moscow's actions and declared last year that it had a “no-limits” friendship with Russia. Beijing has denounced Western sanctions against Moscow, and accused Nato and the United States of provoking Putin's military action.

;

;China has also proposed a peace plan that was largely dismissed by Ukraine's allies, who insisted that Moscow must withdraw its forces from the neighbouring country as a condition for peace.
